description.narrative: Dialogue and partnerships with the Government and donors are established to develop a national social protection framework and to progressively integrate social protection measures into relevant programme areas., which contributes to Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Greater national commitment, accountability and capacity to legislate, plan and budget for inclusive social policies, and progressively integrate social protection measures into relevant programme areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Dialogue and partnerships with the Government and donors are established to develop a national social protection framework and to progressively integrate social protection measures into relevant programme areas.

description.narrative: In 2019, along with its key partners, the World Bank and WFP, UNICEF supported the government in the implementation of the National Social Protection Policy and validation of the first ever National Social Protection Strategy (2019-2023) and action plan. To date, 417,076 children (of which 206,756 girls) benefit from the national social protection programmes in Madagascar, of which 28,453 through UNICEF financing. According to the data recorded in the management information system of the national social protection programmes 1.4 per cent of beneficiaries are children living with disabilities (5,839). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
